clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the treatment of bacterial infections caused by susceptible microorganisms

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: It is a glycopeptide antiobiotic extracted from i Actinoplanes teichomyceticus i with a similar spectrum of activity to vancomycin Its mechanism of action is to inhibit bacterial cell wall synthesis Oral teicoplanin has been demonstrated to be effective in the treatment of pseudomembranous colitis and Clostridium difficile associated diarrhoea with comparable efficacy to vancomycin

incompatibilities.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Picosulfuric acid can be decreased when used in combination with Teicoplanin
The therapeutic efficacy of BCG vaccine can be decreased when used in combination with Teicoplanin
The therapeutic efficacy of Typhoid vaccine can be decreased when used in combination with Teicoplanin
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with Dicoumarol
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with Phenindione
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with Warfarin
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with Phenprocoumon
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with Acenocoumarol
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with 4 hydroxycoumarin
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with Coumarin
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with R warfarin
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with Ethyl biscoumacetate
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with Fluindione
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with Clorindione
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with Diphenadione
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with Tioclomarol
The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Teicoplanin is combined with S Warfarin
The therapeutic efficacy of Lactulose can be decreased when used in combination with Teicoplanin
The therapeutic efficacy of Vibrio cholerae CVD 103 HgR strain live antigen can be decreased when used in combination with Teicoplanin
